revised_title: Effects of Anesthetics on Vegetable and Animal Protoplasm
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to observe the effects of anesthetics (carbon dioxide, ether, and chloroform) on both vegetable and animal protoplasm. They used a leaf of Elodea and a sciatic nerve of Nupharia to compare the results. The study found that chloroform had the most significant impact on the protoplasm, causing a complete arrest of movement. Ether and carbon dioxide also affected the protoplasm, but to a lesser extent. The authors concluded that the observed phenomena were due to the temporary or permanent paralysis of the protoplasm.
